pr_title: Cosmos Paged flux initial POC implementation v4

timeline.message: Added CosmosContinuablePagedFlux initial impelmentation and POC for query

timeline.bodyText: access should be package level not public.
timeline.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText: this constructor is not user facing right? then it should not be public.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText:
Its not even used for now :)
I just added it as it made sense to add something with FeedOptions as parameter for constructor. I will change the public type to package-private.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: aren't we going to have two options class types? now it is not clear if continuationToken is set in FeedOption and also passed by 'CosmosContinuablePageFlux.byPage(continuationToken)' who overrides who.
timeline.author: moderakh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -329,22 +329,33 @@ public String getId() { *

* After subscription the operation will be performed. The {@link Flux} will * contain one or several feed response of the obtained items. In case of - * failure the {@link Flux} will error. + * failure the {@link CosmosContinuablePagedFlux} will error. * * @param the type parameter * @param querySpec the SQL query specification. * @param options the feed options. * @param klass the class type - * @return a {@link Flux} containing one or several feed response pages of the obtained items or an error. + * @return a {@link CosmosContinuablePagedFlux} containing one or several feed response pages of the obtained items or an error. */ - public Flux> queryItems(SqlQuerySpec querySpec, FeedOptions options, Class klass) { - return getDatabase().getDocClientWrapper().queryDocuments(getLink(), - querySpec, options) - .map(response -> BridgeInternal.createFeedResponseWithQueryMetrics( - (CosmosItemProperties - .getTypedResultsFromV2Results((List) (Object) response.getResults(), - klass)), response.getResponseHeaders(), - response.queryMetrics())); + public CosmosContinuablePagedFlux queryItems(SqlQuerySpec querySpec, FeedOptions options, Class klass) {

replies.bodyText:
I agree with the confusion as "who overrides who".
We don't need to necessarily split them. Since continuationToken is used internally from feedOptions class, which we don't need to change.
I think a better solution here would be to hide public setter of continuationToken and maxItemCount. So that end users would have to go via byPage(continuationToken, pageSize) route to set them up, and internally we can copy them to feedOptions, and keep things as it is. We will not have to change the business logic for these.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText:
some questions:

Aren't we going to split the options as discussed earlier?
can you please run a perf benchmark with and without this PR using this benchmark, and see how different the numbers are?
#6771


Regarding options, let's discuss that offline.
Regarding benchmark, I will run them today and will post the numbers here.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.message: Changed constructor to package level. Updated mixed benchmark to take maxItemCount in the API

timeline.bodyText:
each of the reactor transformation will have its own internal buffering, we need to make sure after the transformation, we fetch limited number of items/pages, and possibly configure how many pages should be pre-fetched.
We should have some tests similar to BackPressureCrossPartitionTest and BackpressureTest on the surface query API.
Not necessarily in this PR. but we need to have that.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: Sure, will add those. Thanks for the suggestion.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: @moderakh Added back pressure tests for subscribe call on CosmosContinuablePagedFlux object.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText:

as it is in com.azure.cosmos is it used in the public surface area?

timeline.message: Moved azure-core dependency to parent pom and used same version in azure-cosmos, benchmark and examples pom
Added back pressure tests for CosmosContinuablePagedFlux subscribe call
Updated queryItems sync API to return IterableStream
